perturbation.original_text:
1.3      Term.  The term of this  Agreement  shall be ten (10)
years (the "Term")  which shall  commence on the date
upon which the Company  delivers to  Distributor  the
last Sample, as defined  hereinafter.  If Distributor
complies with all of the terms of this Agreement, the
Agreement  shall be  renewable on an annual basis for
one (1) year terms for up to  another  ten (10) years
on the same terms and conditions as set forth herein.
All renewals of this  Agreement  shall be on the same
terms and conditions as are set forth herein.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.3      Term.  The term of this  Agreement  shall be ten (10)
years (the "Term")  which shall  commence on the date
upon which the Company  delivers to  Distributor  the
last Sample, as defined  hereinafter. The agreement may be terminated at any time, with or without cause, by either party with thirty (30) days written notice. All renewals of this  Agreement  shall be on the same
terms and conditions as are set forth herein.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a ten-year term with potential renewals. The modified text introduces a clause allowing either party to terminate the agreement at any time with 30 days' notice, effectively contradicting the fixed term and the renewal clause. This creates uncertainty about the duration of the agreement and the obligations of each party.

perturbation.original_text:
2.7      Payment Terms.  Distributor  shall pay Company  within  thirty
(30) days of   Distributor's or,  as  the  case  may  be,  the
end-user's receipt of Products.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.7      Payment Terms.  Distributor will attempt to pay Company  within  thirty
(30) days of   Distributor's or,  as  the  case  may  be,  the
end-user's receipt of Products, contingent upon end user payment to the distributor. If end-user payments are delayed by reasons outside of the distributor's control, such as a force majeure event, the distributor is not required to pay the company until thirty days after the distributor receives payment from the end user.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates payment within 30 days. The modified clause introduces a contingency that payment is dependent on the distributor first receiving payment from the end-user, and the distributor is not required to pay if end user payment is delayed by a force majeure. This contradicts the original, strict 30-day payment term, creating confusion about when payment is actually due.

perturbation.original_text:
6.1      Assignment.  No  assignment  of this  Agreement  or any  right
accruing  hereunder  shall be made by the Distributor in whole
or in part,  without the prior written consent of the Company,
which  consent  shall  not  be  unreasonably  withheld.  As  a
condition  to  obtaining   such   consent,   the  Assignee  of
Distributor's  interest hereunder shall first agree in writing
in form and  substance  satisfactory  to the Company,  that is
shall  assume  and  be  liable  for  the  performance  of  all
obligations imposes by this Agreement on Distributor,  whether
such obligations have then accrued are owing, or are yet to be
performed, and shall demonstrate that is has the economic, and
with  approval  of the  assignment,  the legal  capability  to
perform  all  of the  obligations  of  Distributor  hereunder.
Company  may  assign its  interest  in this  agreement  to any
person or entity  which has  authority  to  fulfill  Company's
obligations  hereunder  and which has the economic  ability to
perform its  obligations  hereunder.  Upon the assignment of a
party's  interest and rights in this  Agreement  the assigning
party shall be relieved of all further  obligations imposed by
this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.1      Assignment.  No  assignment  of this  Agreement  or any  right
accruing  hereunder  shall be made by the Distributor in whole
or in part,  without the prior written consent of the Company, which consent may be withheld for any reason or no reason. As  a
condition  to  obtaining   such   consent,   the  Assignee  of
Distributor's  interest hereunder shall first agree in writing
in form and  substance  satisfactory  to the Company,  that is
shall  assume  and  be  liable  for  the  performance  of  all
obligations imposes by this Agreement on Distributor,  whether
such obligations have then accrued are owing, or are yet to be
performed, and shall demonstrate that is has the economic, and
with  approval  of the  assignment,  the legal  capability  to
perform  all  of the  obligations  of  Distributor  hereunder.
Company  may  assign its  interest  in this  agreement  to any
person or entity  which has  authority  to  fulfill  Company's
obligations  hereunder  and which has the economic  ability to
perform its  obligations  hereunder.  Upon the assignment of a
party's  interest and rights in this  Agreement  the assigning
party shall be relieved of all further  obligations imposed by
this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Company's consent to assignment by the Distributor shall not be unreasonably withheld. The modified text removes that limitation, stating that the Company may withhold consent for any reason or no reason at all. This creates a direct contradiction about the conditions under which the Distributor can assign the agreement, affecting their rights and obligations.
